message: Let's start with a reasonable offer, Bob. I believe this split reflects the fact that time is more valuable to me in this scenario.
Alice, considering our different depreciation rates, this is a fair split that benefits us both. With your 20% depreciation rate, waiting will cost you more than accepting this reasonable offer.
Bob, I understand your perspective, but I need a larger share to account for the risk I'm taking with the declining value. This offer is still fair.

Alice, let's be practical. With your 20% depreciation rate, each round is costing you significantly more than it costs me. This 60-40 split in my favor is actually fair when you consider that waiting another round will cost you another 20% in value. We should conclude this now while the money still holds good value for both of us.
Bob, this is a compromise. I've moved closer to your offer, acknowledging that we both lose value over time. Let's settle this now.

Alice, let's finish this now. With your 20% depreciation rate, your portion is rapidly losing value - it's already worth less than half of what it was initially. This offer gives you $350000 now, which is better than a larger number that's worth much less after more rounds of 20% depreciation. If we continue negotiating, your share will be worth even less. This is the optimal time to agree.
Bob, this is it. A straight 50/50 split.  Take it or leave it.  I'm willing to walk away with nothing if you don't see the fairness in this.
